result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Devonte Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Probation to be concurrent to sentence imposed as to case 15CF000522.

miscConds.notes: $4,460.00 to Jordan S. and Colin S..  To be paid first, before costs, fees assessments and surcharges.

Pay the costs, fees, assessments, after restitution has been satisfied.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.    If confinement is served-DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Seek/maintain full time employment or part time employment and school, or full time school.

Court orders: defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done.

Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civl rights are restored.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact order with Jordan S. and/or Colin S.
No contact with any gang members.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Release for work at defendant's fathers business only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Devonte Fisher

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in court with Attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, Roosevelt F., Vercarre W., Joseph P., defense counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  36  months  with  7  days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  24  months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  12 months.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  4  years.  Probation to be CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Case# 15CF000522.

Court finds defendant  IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-  Court sets Restitution as to Jordan S. and Colin S. at $4,460

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Complete a Fatherhood program
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with Jordan S.,   AND/OR   Colin S.
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $4,460 to Jordan S. and Colin S. during the term of probation.  Restitution to be paid first (before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges).  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  No Contact with any gang members
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

As to Case# 15CF000066 only:  Serve  6  (six) months in the House of Correction with release for work at defendant's father's business ONLY.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Complete a Fatherhood program
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with Jordan S.,   AND/OR   Colin S.
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $4,460 to Jordan S. and Colin S. during the term of extended supervision.  Restitution to be paid first (before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges).  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  No Contact with any gang members
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
If Confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
NOTICE OF INTENT TO PURSUE POST-CONVICTION RELIEF RECEIVED AND FILED ON 2-12-16.pk

records.addlTxt:
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in court with Attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  No PSI ordered.  Jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Matter to remain calendared for Jury Trial. Parties request another Final Pretrial. 

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter currently set for Jury Trial on a day in which the Court will not be in session.  Matter rescheduled for final pretrial and jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Telephone call received from Attorney Rosen.  He will wait until the final pretrial date to obtain a new trial date.

The trial date of 9/21/15 that was given on 5/5/15 needs to be rescheduled due to the fact that the Court will not be able to conduct a jury trial on that day due to down-time of the court.  Email sent to ADA Arn and a voice mail massage was left for Attorney Rosen asking if they wanted to wait until the final pretrial date to obtain a new trial date or if they wanted to come in earlier to obtain a new jury trial date.

Defendant Robert Devonte Fisher in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FInal pretrial conducted.  Parties request a new jury trial date that coincides  the the jury trial currently scheduled for defendant's other case.  Parties also request a final pretrial.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Alibi Notice received and filed.

Attorney Mark S Rosen in court, defendant Robert Devonte Fisher not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel was confused on when the court date was scheduled.  Since the defendant is in custody and the parties are simply requesting an additional final pre-trial date, the parties requested that the case be heard now, before the scheduled date of 07/08/2015.  Parties were given an additional final pre-trial date. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Discharge Summary Report, received and filed.

Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
